TEXT.citation: Early, R. J., & Whitehorn, J. (2003). One hundred Paiwan texts. Pacific Linguistics, Research School of Pacific and Asian Studies, The Australian National University.
TEXT.BibTeX_citation: @book{100paiwantexts, author = {Robert Early and John Whitehorn}, title = {One Hundred Paiwan Texts}, year = {2003}, publisher = {Pacific Linguistics, Research School of Pacific and Asian Studies, The Australian National University}}

S.FORM: izua i Makazayazaya aza ti Tjukutjuku putsekeł tjai Kułełułełu, puałak tjai Pułałułałuyan.
izoa i Makazayazaya aza ti Tjokotjoko pocekelj tjai Koljeljoljeljo, poaljak tjai Poljaljoljaljoyan.
S.TRANSL: In Makazayazaya there was a person called Tjukutjuku who married Kułełułełu, and they had a child called Pułałułałuyan.

S.FORM: i Makalaulauz ti Muakakai putsekeł tjai Pułałułałuyan, puałak tjai Tjukutjuku.
i Makalaolaoz ti Moakakai pocekelj tjai Poljaljoljaljoyan, poaljak tjai Tjokotjoko.
S.TRANSL: In Makalaulauz Muakakai married Pułałułałuyan, and their child was Tjukutjuku.

S.FORM: vaik ti Pułałułałuyan a kisudju tjai Tjukutjuku.
vaik ti Poljaljoljaljoyan a kisodjo tjai Tjokotjoko.
S.TRANSL: Pułałułałuyan went to court Tjukutjuku.

S.FORM: sipakatjeluł vaik a tsemikel sema Makazayazaya.
sipakatjelolj vaik a cemikel sema Makazayazaya.
S.TRANSL: On the third day he went back to Makazayazaya.

S.FORM: "sa-u, Vungavan, kivadaqi tu kemudakuda a silisi."
"sa-o, Vongavan, kivadaqi to kemodakoda a silisi."
S.TRANSL: “Vungavan, go and ask about the bride-price.”

S.FORM: "aku a izua za putjaumaumał aza lisian tu mamazangiłan?
"ako a izoa za potjaomaomalj aza lisian to mamazangiljan?
S.TRANSL: “Why should there be any change in the bride-price for chiefs?

S.FORM: taiday za taiday anga; pusiłevavaw tu tapuluq."
taiday za taiday anga; posiljevavaw to tapoloq."
S.TRANSL: A hundred is a hundred, and add ten.”

S.FORM: "anema aya, vuvu i Vungavan?"
"anema aya, vovo i Vongavan?"
S.TRANSL: “What do they say, Granny Vungavan?”

S.FORM: "'aku a izua za putjaumaumał aza lisian tu mamazangiłan?
"'ako a izoa za potjaomaomalj aza lisian to mamazangiljan?
S.TRANSL: “They just say: ‘Why should there be any change in bride-price for chiefs?

S.FORM: taiday za taiday anga; pusiłevavaw tu tapuluq', aya sakamaya."
taiday za taiday anga; posiljevavaw to tapoloq', aya sakamaya."
S.TRANSL: A hundred is a hundred, and add ten.’”

S.FORM: "ki tjen a qemałup nutiaw, ła qalian, a kivełangaw tja sipaputsekeł.
"ki tjen a qemaljop notiaw, lja qalian, a kiveljangaw tja sipapocekelj.
S.TRANSL: “We’ll go hunting tomorrow, friends, and get head-wreaths for the wedding.

S.FORM: ari qałupi.
ari qaljopi.
S.TRANSL: Come on, let’s go hunting.

S.FORM: kivełangałangavu a maqatsuvutsuvung.
kiveljangaljangavo a maqacovocovong.
S.TRANSL: Young people, collect the head-wreaths;

S.FORM: vetsiku a ramałemałeng.
veciko a ramaljemaljeng.
S.TRANSL: old people carve the meat.

S.FORM: tja su tjatjainu anan a łavalian?"
tja so tjatjaino anan a ljavalian?"
S.TRANSL: How should the grass decorations be?”

S.FORM: "tja su tjakakeḍi anan."
"tja so tjakakedri anan."
S.TRANSL: “The smaller the better.”

S.FORM: "ari saumaqi anga."
"ari saomaqi anga."
S.TRANSL: “Come on, let’s go home.”

S.FORM: "tjumaqu anan a kaiv."
"tjomaqo anan a kaiv."
S.TRANSL: “Go home and have supper.”

S.FORM: tsikel anga a maqatsuvutsuvung a ramałemałeng, sa seman vełangałangaw a maqatsuvutsuvung, seman vutjuvutjuł a ramałemałeng.
cikel anga a maqacovocovong a ramaljemaljeng, sa seman veljangaljangaw a maqacovocovong, seman votjovotjolj a ramaljemaljeng.
S.TRANSL: The young and old go back, and the young make head-wreaths, and the old deal with the meat.

S.FORM: "ari anga a paputsekeł a sema Makalaulauz."
"ari anga a papocekelj a sema Makalaolaoz."
S.TRANSL: “Let’s go to Makalaulauz for the wedding.”

S.FORM: sa vaik a tamaqałan tjału sasukuzan.
sa vaik a tamaqaljan tjaljo sasokozan.
S.TRANSL: So the whole village went to the resting place.

S.FORM: matu matateztez sinikuang.
mato matateztez sinikoang.
S.TRANSL: Shots echoed round. (?)

S.FORM: "tsasavu, ła Tjukutjuku.
"casavo, lja Tjokotjoko.
S.TRANSL: “Come out, Tjukutjuku clan.

S.FORM: uzay anga a se Makazayazaya."
ozay anga a se Makazayazaya."
S.TRANSL: Makazayazaya people are here.”

S.FORM: "uzay anga nia apu.
"ozay anga nia apo.
S.TRANSL: “Here’s our betel-nut.

S.FORM: ki mun a namaqusaw anga, ki mun a namavali anga, nu sika i djalan anga."
ki mon a namaqosaw anga, ki mon a namavali anga, no sika i djalan anga."
S.TRANSL: You will be thirsty and wind-blown from the journey.”

S.FORM: "ui anga.
"oi anga.
S.TRANSL: “Yes indeed,

S.FORM: namaqusaw anga men, namavali anga men, nia sika i djalan anga."
namaqosaw anga men, namavali anga men, nia sika i djalan anga."
S.TRANSL: we are thirsty and wind-blown from our journey.

S.FORM: sipakatjeluł "ari anga.
sipakatjelolj "ari anga.
S.TRANSL: On the third day they said: “Let’s go now.

S.FORM: mavurvur anga ła tja kakeḍian ła tja ramałemałeng."
mavorvor anga lja tja kakedrian lja tja ramaljemaljeng."
S.TRANSL: Our children and old people will be anxious.”

S.FORM: ta tsavił anga ti Pułałułałuyan i Makalaulauz; qau sa ika puałak.
ta cavilj anga ti Poljaljoljaljoyan i Makalaolaoz; qao sa ika poaljak.
S.TRANSL: Pułałułałuyan was a year in Makalaulauz; but no child was born.

S.FORM: "sa-u, Vungavan.
"sa-o, Vongavan.
S.TRANSL: “Go, Vungavan,

S.FORM: 'idu alapan amen ta vaqu i salang,' aya-u ti Pułałułałuyan."
'ido alapan amen ta vaqo i salang,' aya-o ti Poljaljoljaljoyan."
S.TRANSL: tell Pułałułałuyan: ‘Get us some millet from the granary.’”

S.FORM: "aku a mangtjez sun, vuvu i Vungavan?"
"ako a mangtjez son, vovo i Vongavan?"
S.TRANSL: “Why have you come, Granny Vungavan?”

S.FORM: "singelit aken tjanumun."
"singelit aken tjanomon."
S.TRANSL: “I missed you.”

S.FORM: "anema aya ti Pułałułałuyan?"
"anema aya ti Poljaljoljaljoyan?"
S.TRANSL: “What does Pułałułałuyan say?”

S.FORM: "marekutj aken a patjanema.
"marekotj aken a patjanema.
S.TRANSL: “I was afraid to say anything

S.FORM: nu ku patsunan a namare kikavetsengel."
no ko paconan a namare kikavecengel."
S.TRANSL: when I saw all the crops.” (?)

S.FORM: "sa-u, Vurivuri.
"sa-o, Vorivori.
S.TRANSL: “Go, Vurivuri,

S.FORM: qaqivu ti Pułałułałuyan."
qaqivo ti Poljaljoljaljoyan."
S.TRANSL: speak to Pułałułałuyan.”

S.FORM: "aku a mangtjeztjez sun, vuvu i Vurivuri."
"ako a mangtjeztjez son, vovo i Vorivori."
S.TRANSL: “Why have you come, Granny Vurivuri?”

S.FORM: "'idu,' aya tia tjaina, 'alapan amen ta vaqu a sema salang'."
"'ido,' aya tia tjaina, 'alapan amen ta vaqo a sema salang'."
S.TRANSL: “Your mother’s family say: ‘Get some millet for us from the granary.’”

S.FORM: "aku a sikałałava tjanuaken?"
"ako a sikaljaljava tjanoaken?"
S.TRANSL: “Why are you waiting for me?”

S.FORM: "ui, ari, anema aya?
"oi, ari, anema aya?
S.TRANSL: “Yes, come on. What does he say?

S.FORM: nakuya tsu ika mun a puałak.
nakoya co ika mon a poaljak.
S.TRANSL: It’s bad that you have no child.

S.FORM: kitjuvadayu sakamaya."
kitjovadayo sakamaya."
S.TRANSL: Get on and separate.”

S.FORM: "iya, manu anema nu siaya?
"iya, mano anema no siaya?
S.TRANSL: “Oh, so what are you saying?

S.FORM: iru aken a pukaui a kitjuvaday."
iro aken a pokaoi a kitjovaday."
S.TRANSL: I won’t agree to separate.”

S.FORM: "anema aya tia kama tia kina tjanusun?"
"anema aya tia kama tia kina tjanoson?"
S.TRANSL: “What do your father and mother say to you?”

S.FORM: "inika anema aya."
"inika anema aya."
S.TRANSL: “Nothing.”

S.FORM: sa qemauqaung tia Tjukutjuku kati Pułałułałuyan.
sa qemaoqaong tia Tjokotjoko kati Poljaljoljaljoyan.
S.TRANSL: And Tjukutjuku and Pułałułałuyan cried.

S.FORM: lemigu a se Kanavanavał tu mavurvurvur tia Tjukutjuku.
lemigo a se Kanavanavalj to mavorvorvor tia Tjokotjoko.
S.TRANSL: The Kanavanavał people heard that the Tjukutjuku family were anxious.

S.FORM: "ari, kisudju-i a sema Makalaulauz," aya.
"ari, kisodjo-i a sema Makalaolaoz," aya.
S.TRANSL: “Come on, let’s go courting to Makalaulauz,” they said.

S.FORM: saka izuanan ti Pułałułałuyan.
saka izoanan ti Poljaljoljaljoyan.
S.TRANSL: Now Pułałułałuyan was still there.

S.FORM: "uzay anga a se Kanavanavał a muri kisudju tjanusun.
"ozay anga a se Kanavanavalj a mori kisodjo tjanoson.
S.TRANSL: “There are Kanavanavał people here who want to court you.

S.FORM: łakua iru a sika suḍam uta.
ljakoa iro a sika sodram ota.
S.TRANSL: But it’s not to be resented.

S.FORM: imazamazanan aken.
imazamazanan aken.
S.TRANSL: I’m still here.

S.FORM: qau a marekakakaka itjen a puraketj.
qao a marekakakaka itjen a poraketj.
S.TRANSL: We are siblings for ever.

S.FORM: tsasavu, ła Tjukutjuku," aya ti Pułałułałuyan.
casavo, lja Tjokotjoko," aya ti Poljaljoljaljoyan.
S.TRANSL: Come out, Tjukutjuku clan,” said Pułałułałuyan.

S.FORM: "iru aken a pukaui."
"iro aken a pokaoi."
S.TRANSL: “I won’t agree.”

S.FORM: "kana ika sun a pukaui, ki navaik aken a sema Makazayazaya."
"kana ika son a pokaoi, ki navaik aken a sema Makazayazaya."
S.TRANSL: “If you don’t agree, I’ll go off to Makazayazaya.”

S.FORM: sa vaik anga ti Tjukutjuku a sema tsasaw.
sa vaik anga ti Tjokotjoko a sema casaw.
S.TRANSL: So Tjukutjuku went outside.

S.FORM: "uzay anga nia apu kinarasingan.
"ozay anga nia apo kinarasingan.
S.TRANSL: “Here’s our betel-nut and beer.

S.FORM: tekelu anga.
tekelo anga.
S.TRANSL: Have a drink.

S.FORM: ki mun a namaqusaw anga; ki mun a namavali anga; nu sika i djalan anga, nu sika i sasukuzan anga."
ki mon a namaqosaw anga; ki mon a namavali anga; no sika i djalan anga, no sika i sasokozan anga."
S.TRANSL: You’ll be thirsty and wind-blown from your journey and from being at the resting place.”

S.FORM: "ui, nia gaugavi, sa nia apu-i, sa nia tekeli.
"oi, nia gaogavi, sa nia apo-i, sa nia tekeli.
S.TRANSL: “Yes, we accept; we’ll chew betel and drink.

S.FORM: namaqusaw anga men, namavali anga men a paquliqulid."
namaqosaw anga men, namavali anga men a paqoliqolid."
S.TRANSL: We certainly are thirsty and wind-blown.”

S.FORM: sipakatjeluł "ari anga."
sipakatjelolj "ari anga."
S.TRANSL: On the third day they said: “Now let’s go.”

S.FORM: sa sema Kanavanavał anga tjału sasukuzan.
sa sema Kanavanavalj anga tjaljo sasokozan.
S.TRANSL: And they went to Kanavanavał to the resting place.

S.FORM: "sa-u, vuvu i Vungavan, tsikelu sa kivadaqi tu kemudakuda a silisi."
"sa-o, vovo i Vongavan, cikelo sa kivadaqi to kemodakoda a silisi."
S.TRANSL: “Go, Granny Vungavan; go back and ask the bride-price.”

S.FORM: "aku a izua putjaumaumał aza lisian tu mamazangiłan?
"ako a izoa potjaomaomalj aza lisian to mamazangiljan?
S.TRANSL: “Why should there be any change in the bride-price for chiefs?

S.FORM: taiday za taiday anga; pusiłevavaw tu tapuluq."
taiday za taiday anga; posiljevavaw to tapoloq."
S.TRANSL: A hundred is a hundred; and add ten.”

S.FORM: "anema aya?"
"anema aya?"
S.TRANSL: “What do they say?”

S.FORM: "'aku a izua za putjaumaumał aza lisian tu mamazangiłan?
"'ako a izoa za potjaomaomalj aza lisian to mamazangiljan?
S.TRANSL: “They just say: ‘Why should there be any change in the bride-price for chiefs?

S.FORM: taiday za taiday anga; pusiłevavaw tu tapuluq,' aya sakamaya."
taiday za taiday anga; posiljevavaw to tapoloq,' aya sakamaya."
S.TRANSL: A hundred is a hundred; and add ten.’”

S.FORM: "ari, anema aya?
"ari, anema aya?
S.TRANSL: “Come on, what do they say?

S.FORM: qałupi, sa tja kivełangavi."
qaljopi, sa tja kiveljangavi."
S.TRANSL: Let’s go hunting, and collect head-wreaths.”

S.FORM: sipakapusał a qemałuqałup.
sipakaposalj a qemaljoqaljop.
S.TRANSL: They hunted for two days.

S.FORM: "kivełangavu a maqatsuvutsuvung, vutsiqu a ramałemałeng.
"kiveljangavo a maqacovocovong, vociqo a ramaljemaljeng.
S.TRANSL: “Young people, collect the head-wreaths; old people carve the meat.

S.FORM: tja su tjatjainu anan a łavalian?"
tja so tjatjaino anan a ljavalian?"
S.TRANSL: How should the grass decorations be?”

S.FORM: "tja su tjakakeḍi anan.
"tja so tjakakedri anan.
S.TRANSL: “The smaller the better.”

S.FORM: tjezua aza.
tjezoa aza.
S.TRANSL: “That’s enough.

S.FORM: ari saumaqi.
ari saomaqi.
S.TRANSL: Come on, let’s go home.

S.FORM: maselem a qadaw.
maselem a qadaw.
S.TRANSL: Daylight is going.

S.FORM: surava-i a tja kinivełangaw a tja inalap.
sorava-i a tja kiniveljangaw a tja inalap.
S.TRANSL: Let’s unload the head-wreaths we’ve collected.

S.FORM: sa-u kaivu anan."
sa-o kaivo anan."
S.TRANSL: Go and get supper.”

S.FORM: tsemikel anga a maqatsuvutsuvung a ramałemałeng.
cemikel anga a maqacovocovong a ramaljemaljeng.
S.TRANSL: The young and old come back.

S.FORM: "sanu vełangałangavu a maqatsuvutsuvung, sanu vutjułu a ramałemałeng.
"sano veljangaljangavo a maqacovocovong, sano votjoljo a ramaljemaljeng.
S.TRANSL: “Young people, make wreaths; old people, deal with the meat.

S.FORM: ki tjen a vaik a nutiaw a sema Makalaulauz a putsekeł.
ki tjen a vaik a notiaw a sema Makalaolaoz a pocekelj.
S.TRANSL: Tomorrow we’ll go to Makalaulauz for the wedding.

S.FORM: ari a tamaqałan."
ari a tamaqaljan."
S.TRANSL: Let the whole village go.”

S.FORM: uzay anga a se Kanavanavał i sasukuzan anga.
ozay anga a se Kanavanavalj i sasokozan anga.
S.TRANSL: The Kanavanavał people were there at the resting place.

S.FORM: matu mateztez a sinikuang.
mato mateztez a sinikoang.
S.TRANSL: Shots echoed round.

S.FORM: namaya i Makalaulauz a uta; sa pangtjez i katsasavan.
namaya i Makalaolaoz a ota; sa pangtjez i kacasavan.
S.TRANSL: The same in Makalaulauz too. So they reached the courtyard.

S.FORM: "tsasavu, ła Tjukutjuku."
"casavo, lja Tjokotjoko."
S.TRANSL: “Come out, Tjukutjuku clan.”

S.FORM: "iru aken a pukaui."
"iro aken a pokaoi."
S.TRANSL: “I won’t agree.”

S.FORM: qemaung sakamaya ti Tjukutjuku; namaya ti Pułałułałuyan.
qemaong sakamaya ti Tjokotjoko; namaya ti Poljaljoljaljoyan.
S.TRANSL: Tjukutjuku just cries. So does Pułałułałuyan.

S.FORM: "tsasavu sakamaya.
"casavo sakamaya.
S.TRANSL: “Just come out.

S.FORM: kana ika sun a pukaui, ki navaik aken a sema Makazayazaya."
kana ika son a pokaoi, ki navaik aken a sema Makazayazaya."
S.TRANSL: If you don’t agree, I’ll go to Makazayazaya.”

S.FORM: sa tsasaw anga ti Tjukutjuku sipakatjeluł.
sa casaw anga ti Tjokotjoko sipakatjelolj.
S.TRANSL: So Tjukutjuku came out on the third day.

S.FORM: sa vaik ti Pułałułałuyan a sema Makazayazaya.
sa vaik ti Poljaljoljaljoyan a sema Makazayazaya.
S.TRANSL: And Pułałułałuyan went to Makazayazaya.

S.FORM: sipakasimuluq matsay ti Pułałułałuyan.
sipakasimoloq macay ti Poljaljoljaljoyan.
S.TRANSL: On the tenth day Pułałułałuyan died.

S.FORM: sipakivadaq tu pasainu a tsemveł.
sipakivadaq to pasaino a cemvelj.
S.TRANSL: They asked where he should be buried.

S.FORM: "pasazua-u aken ta pautez na kadjunangan a pasa kanavanavał."
"pasazoa-o aken ta paotez na kadjonangan a pasa kanavanavalj."
S.TRANSL: “Put me at the edge of the land towards the south(-east) (or Kanavanavał).”

S.FORM: matsay anga makełang ti Pułałułałuyan.
macay anga makeljang ti Poljaljoljaljoyan.
S.TRANSL: Pułałułałuyan was known to be dead.

S.FORM: "ari kivangavangi a sema Kanavanavał," aya ti Tjukutjuku.
"ari kivangavangi a sema Kanavanavalj," aya ti Tjokotjoko.
S.TRANSL: “Let’s go to Kanavanavał,” said Tjukutjuku.

S.FORM: tjału zua ta tsinevełan tjai Pułałułałuyan.
tjaljo zoa ta cineveljan tjai Poljaljoljaljoyan.
S.TRANSL: They went to where Pułałułałuyan was buried.

S.FORM: "tjaula-i aken.
"tjaola-i aken.
S.TRANSL: “Leave me here.

S.FORM: kitsungal anan aken," aya, sa kisan kaḍiaḍi, sa vaik a minlayap tia Tjukutjuku kati Pułałułałuyan.
kicongal anan aken," aya, sa kisan kadriadri, sa vaik a minlayap tia Tjokotjoko kati Poljaljoljaljoyan.
S.TRANSL: I’m going to pay my respects,” she said, and turned into a butterfly. So Tjukutjuku and Pułałułałuyan flew away.

S.FORM: sa manu vaik anga kivadaq ta qadaw: "kemuda kana ika men a puałak?"
sa mano vaik anga kivadaq ta qadaw: "kemoda kana ika men a poaljak?"
S.TRANSL: And so they went to ask the sun: “Why can’t we have children?”

S.FORM: pavay tu tjara mau ita nia sialangan anga a qadaw, sa puałak tjai Kułełułełu.
pavay to tjara mao ita nia sialangan anga a qadaw, sa poaljak tjai Koljeljoljeljo.
S.TRANSL: The sun gave each of them one source of life, and they had a child called Kułełułełu.

S.FORM: sema katsauan aza ti Kułełułełu; vaik a sema Makazayazaya, sa penałipałi a sinipapipułuan ta anemaneman anga.
sema kacaoan aza ti Koljeljoljeljo; vaik a sema Makazayazaya, sa penaljipalji a sinipapipoljoan ta anemaneman anga.
S.TRANSL: This Kułełułełu came into the world, and went to Makazayazaya, and (magically) destroyed all the signs of mourning.

S.FORM: "tima tsu?
"tima co?
S.TRANSL: “Who is this?

S.FORM: kemasinu tsu nu qałan?
kemasino co no qaljan?
S.TRANSL: What village does he come from?

S.FORM: tja djameqaw sakamaya."
tja djameqaw sakamaya."
S.TRANSL: We’ll just kill him.”

S.FORM: "qadjaw nimun.
"qadjaw nimon.
S.TRANSL: “It’s up to you.

S.FORM: ła vuvu i Tjukutjuku, ła vuvu i Kułełułełu.
lja vovo i Tjokotjoko, lja vovo i Koljeljoljeljo.
S.TRANSL: Granny Tjukutjuku, Grandpa Kułełułełu,

S.FORM: timunay a sangasangasan a djemameq tjanuaken.
timonay a sangasangasan a djemameq tjanoaken.
S.TRANSL: you should be the first to kill me.

S.FORM: ałak aken nia kina i Tjukutjuku, nia kama i Pułałułałuyan."
aljak aken nia kina i Tjokotjoko, nia kama i Poljaljoljaljoyan."
S.TRANSL: Tjukutjuku was my mother; Pułałułałuyan was my father.”

S.FORM: sa izuanga sakamaya.
sa izoanga sakamaya.
S.TRANSL: So he stayed on there.
